name: Anonymous
com:
/vmg/ is a place to discuss all types of mobile games, including both Android and iOS, phones and tablets. Please note that Nintendo and Sony handhelds are considered consoles, and that threads pertaining to those platforms and their gaming titles should be posted elsewhere.

Does this mean discussion of mobile games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vmg/ is just a separate board specifically focused on mobile games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vmg/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

com:
There's a chill in the air! Filled with Cookie Run Games! Here's your holiday catchup:

Ovenbreak
>Meet Lollipop Cookie via the gacha or the Trophy Race/breakout Event!
>Guild Mission: Starry Aeroplane! Missions for treasures? Sounds familiar!
>Treasure Mastery - Starry Aeroplane! You've got it, now use it!
>Grand Champion's League is here! We're cheering for YOU because YOU are gonna win!
>Way of the Cookie - Recieve a chance for an old lobby!
>Cookie of the Year 2022 - Early celebration! Birthday Cake Cookie won! Amazing!
>Escape Level Rework! Inflation strikes again!
>Cookie Detective! Who kidnapped Eggnog Cookie?
>New costumes for Chestnut and Eggnog!
>Customizable lobby sets!
Kingdom
>Meet Carol Cookie! An Epic healing cookie back from the LINE era who supports the team in different way depending on the situation! Featured gacha and new events end in 35 days!
>Meet Sherbet Cookie! A new Ranged Super Epic Cookie who can freeze enemies around you! Obtainable in the new events!
>Snow-covered Path event! Unlock Story and goodies for a chance to get Sherbet Cookie!
>Holiday Cake Shop to bake delicious (shitpost to your heart's content) cakes!
>Cookie Holidays event story! Bake more cakes to unlock more stories from Carol Cookie!
>Tower of Sweet Chaos tiers upgraded for a Grand total of 250!
>14, yes, you've heard me right, 14 more BTS Cookies costumes!
>New Epic Treasure: Hollyberrian Royal Necklace!
>Chance Up feature added to treasure gacha for better odds at what you want!
>Buffed Sacred Pomegranate Branch! You may want to use a shield killer once in a while again!
Puzzle World
>Is being hopeful for a flashy execution!

Who is the culprit? Who is YOUR Cookie of the Year? Do you agree with the top 5? Has Cookie Run had a good year? What would your favorite cookie want/give for Christmas? What are your hopes for 2023 cookie content? What was your favorite cookie content this year? Will Rose make it to 2024? Have a Merry Christmas and discuss all things Cookie Run!

The only guy in the game (other than limited halloween Lelouch) that gives Stealth to your units. Faggots with rifles and bazookas who stops just outside your unit's LOS to shoot them will be forced to come closer.
>3* Lelouch
Stuns everyone in his LOS for a few seconds. Really good, but I'm too smoothbrain to use Kings and I managed to finish the main story without him.
Some quick recommendations because I'm running out of space. These guys are lower
priority.
>3* Shirley
>4* Suzaku
>4* Lloyd
>3* Kirihara (old man)
>4* Rakshata
>2* Senba (bald JLF dude)

Put orange on melee Sutherland or cheap kmf. The idea is to deploy orange (and school kallen) then retreat to generate cost. You can further boost the efficiency by deploying rakshata to cut the cd if you have spare slot. Generally you want to raise 2 cost generators, 2 tanks, 2 melee dps, 2 ranged dps, 2 healer.

>cost generator
orange(melee Sutherland or cheap kmf) & school kallen (cheap kmf)
(ideally use kallen glasgow)
>tank
senba + tohdo/school suzaku
(kmf with high def)
>melee dps
mc, urabe
(lancelot, spear darlton gloucester)
>ranged dps
mc, kewell, villeta if you need another anti air
(varis lancelot, palomides, Sutherland)
>healer
chiba, milly
(same as ranged dps)
>support
diethard (stealth), school lelouch (stun), kirihara (black knight aspd buff), kimono milly(push)

I wouldn't mind PC versions, but I enjoy games where numbers go up and I can freely play how the fuck I want without the game sending me down linear pathways until the credits run.
Sadly few videogames do this nowadays, and to my surprise the mobile sector is full of it. It's not telling me who or what to invest into. It doesn't give a shit that I don't want to do the story now, but later. No big hallway to follow down when it comes to progression, but I can do what I think I need.

I know, not everyone cares, but I like those kind of games. And when Rpgs on pc/consoles became dogshit because everything has to be boring and linear to the point they cut even out rewarding exploration, I may as well play mobile games. Some of them do even HAVE rewarding exploration nowadays, though they are usually played better on PC.
That said, most mobile games still suck ass. Gotta find what's nice for you.

tl;dr: I like to be able to think myself on how I play the game, and for whatever goddamn reason the mobile game sector is much better with that than offline games are nowadays. Sadly so.

last_replies.com:
>>1065291
I wouldn't know, anon. Browsing through the popular and unpopular titles makes it look like an uphill battle to do honest business where you intend to offer high quality, reasonably priced/monetized software.
Freetards take mobile gaming for granted, don't care about ads or block them, won't pay even 20 cents upfront, and if they have some pocket change, they'd rather blow it on gachashit jpegs. Some devs cope by releasing a part of the game or even the whole thing for free and including an IAP with more content. Some offer a free version with ads and a paid version without ads + some extra stuff, and man, the difference in downloaded copies is hefty.
Google seems to hate ad-free games, both paid and free, so you'll have to shill your game on your own. There are many nice games that fail to get more than ten thousand or even one hundred downloads. I think the numbers on the super popular games are padded with fake traffic from chink sweatshops, who knows. Some of the popular games have a Steam version, I guess that's a way to get extra exposure.
>make a good RPG and charge $5
That price range includes games such as Stardew Valley, Out There, or Ticket to Earth so the competition looks fierce.
